solution.text:
Curved surface area of a cylinder\(=_{{trunc((pi_val*2*2*j*j),3)}}_\,cm^2\)
Radius\(=2 \times\)Height\(\Rightarrow r=2h\)
CSA of cylinder\(=2\pi rh=_{{trunc((pi_val*2*2*j*j),3)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow rh=\frac{_{{trunc((pi_val*2*2*j*j),3)}}_}{2\pi}\)
\(\Rightarrow 2h^2=_{{2*j*j}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow h=_{j}_\,cm\)
Therefore, \(r=2h=2\times _{j}_=_{{2*j}}_\,cm\)
Volume of the cylinder\(=\pi r^2h\)
\(=\pi \times _{{2*j}}_^2 \times _{j}_\)
\(=_{{trunc((pi_val*4*j**3),3)}}_\,cm^3\)

content.text: If the curved surface area of a cylinder is \(_{{trunc((pi_val*2*2*j*j),3)}}_\)sq.cm and radius is twice the height, what is its volume?
